name: Disney's Wilderness Lodge

reviews.text: Our stay at Wilderness Lodge in late October couldn't have been better! The hotel was magnificent and the staff couldn't have been nicer! I was concerned when we went to our room (6052) and it looked over the loading dock area (if you looked straight down). However, looking out toward the park, we were facing Magic Kingdom and could watch the fireworks from our room every night!! It seems there is always a silver lining at Disney! We were traveling with our 5 yr old grandson and found the room to be set up well for a family. The restaurant, Roaring Forks was the most ideal restaurant I've used in any hotel at Disney! Great food choices for every meal and the ease of being able to come and go at your own pace, due to it's self-serve nature. The convenience of using the boat transportation from the dock behind the hotel cannot be beat! An all-round PERFECT vacation was had!
reviews.title: Great Stay at Wilderness Lodge

reviews.text: The front desk person was from Perth, Australia and she made us feel right at home the second we walked in. She told us all about the hotel and she upgraded us to a suite as it was my son's birthday. The room was very comfortable and the kids enjoyed the towel animals that the housekeeping crew made. The pool and hot tubs were great and had a slide. They had lifeguards on duty all day and into the night. The lobby and restaurants in the lodge were very good. We enjoyed Whispering Canyons a lot, be careful when you ask the waiter for ketchup. The club access was perfect as they offered food throughout the day and even beer, wine, etc... for adults. Getting to the parks was relatively easy via bus or boat, although at times we waited a bit. I would highly recommend this location and would stay there again.
reviews.title: Great place for adults and kids

reviews.text: You know you are not just on any vacation but a Disney Vacation when you pull up to this wonderful resort. The closer you get the bigger it gets, the way it fits into the Surroundings is amazing. When you pull up under the Huge overhang to drop off your luggage and family, you hear the music and instantly get swept away. Walk through the front doors and a transformation takes place, you are taken to a different place and time in history. You forget that just outside lies the pure magic of Disney. The sounds of other families, resort tour guides, the sound of the bubbling spring, yes there is a spring in the lobby, takes you away and the outside world is replaced by a Disney World.
reviews.title: What a wonderful Place

reviews.text: The rooms are spacious, comfortable, not that you will be spending much time in it. Back to the Spring. In the back of the lobby there is a small Bridge that goes over a babbling brook that starts with a spring that gently pours up out of the ground. Turn around and look through the huge viewing windows and an entirely different landscape unfolds. Walk out the back doors and follow the stream from under, yes under, the wall and down through a rock arch way, a short flight of stairs and you come to the end at the pool. In true Diisney fashion the pool area is now a Scenic over look as you would see in Yellow Stone. There is a replica of "Old Faithful" that goes of on schedule.
reviews.title: Best Disney Hotel

reviews.text: Look just past the majestic scene and you see breathtaking scenes of what used to be "Discovery Island" and the shore line of the lake. All the water sports, Including Small boats called "Water Sprites" to guided fishing trips, Para-sailing. So much to do that your vacation could be spent at the resort, but don't limit your self. There is so much to do and the key to getting in as much as you can, with out wearing yourself out, is planning.
reviews.title: Northwest Wilderness Wow!

reviews.text: This is a great location close to Magic Kingdom by water shuttle.
reviews.title: Great location close to Magic Kingdom

reviews.text: Rooms are nice with balcony.
reviews.title: My new favorite hotel at Disney

reviews.text: The only drawback is their resteraunt called the Wispering Canyons. It is loud and you can hear it from your room. My room was by the back of the lodge in the main lobby facing bay lake. They gave me a hastle for breakfast making you wait even though they had open tables. I would recommend going to ft wilderness for dinner. They have a nice buffet and no waiting. Same food a hoopy do revue.
reviews.title: Close but no cigare

reviews.text: Nice pool, water suttle to magic kingdom and ft wilderness is great. quick service is limited, if you have car buy bagels for breakfast. Can use toaster and they have all the topping out.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.text: We are from the Orlando area but have little ones and so try to stay over if we're committing to Disney. I have always been adamant about staying at one of the hotels on the monorail, which is a lot more expensive but a lot less stressful with a huge double stroller and two littles. This is my new favorite (if you are going to the Magic Kingdom). It is one easy boat ride away from being dropped smack dab in front of the Magic Kingdom entrance! Plus, it is a lot more reasonable than the other *deluxe* resorts on property. Kids will love it. They have a great pool and a lot for the kids to do. They have an adult restaurant and a family restaurant ... don't do room service ... it's atrocious. Nice people, bad food.
reviews.title: BEAUTIFUL LODGE

reviews.text: This was our first time at the Wilderness Lodge and it will not be our last. Our family had a bunkbed room that overlooked the pool area and it was very nice. We usually took the buses to get to the parks and rode the boat back from the Magic Kingdom. Loved how close it was to the main park, since that was where we were most of the time. I would recommend this resort to anyone with small kids down to someone traveling solo. The decor was rustic and made you feel that you were in an old hunting lodge somewhere. They have a great pool area and several spas also. Always something going on around the pool area to entertain the kids and movies at night down on the beach area.
reviews.title: October time at the lodge

reviews.text: My sister and I took an adult trip to Disney and we decided to try Wilderness Lodge this time. We loved it!! From the second we stepped off of the Magical Express to the time we left was A+ for us. The customer service here was top notch! Our view was not great but we did not pay for a great view so it wasn't a problem for us. The food court was a lot smaller than the value and moderate resorts which was a little disappointing but the food was always excellent. The lobby was amazing and the restaurants were fantastic. I would highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Best Disney Stay Yet!

reviews.text: We loved our stay at The Wilderness Lodge, they have very nice and spacious rooms, and they have a beautiful pool. They also have an extremely nice lobby. It's in a good location as well. I would recommend this hotel to fellow Disney goers anytime.
reviews.title: Very Nice.

reviews.text: We love the Wildnerness Lodge and have stayed there 4 times over the past 8 years. It is a great place because it is not as large as some of the other Disney properties. You can take the boat to the Magic Kingdom and walk or ride bikes to the Fort Wilderness Campground. We like to stay in the Jr. Suite which has a small sitting area and a separate bedroom. On the nights the kids were exhausted and needed to get to bed, we could stay up and relax without disturbing them. The Roaring Forks is a great quick-service food option and they also have the Artist's Pointe which is our favorite high-end fine dining experience in Disney. The Whispering Canyon Cafe is also on site and a lot of fun for all. It is an interactive dining experience typical of Disney and the kids have a ball! The pool is great fun with a small slide coming off of a rock mountain and there is a geyser to watch every hour. At night, the electric light parade moves through the Lagoon and we went to the dock to watch it or we'd see it from the boat on our way back from the Magic Kingdom. It's just a very special place to spend your Disney vacation. We've stayed at other resorts, but always find our way back to the Wildnerness Lodge.
reviews.title: Great for a family vacation

reviews.text: I have visited Walt Disney World 18 times over the past 16 years, staying on property at one of their resort hotels 17 of those times. My favorite Disney resort hotel has been the Wilderness Lodge (WL). The moment you walk in the front door, you are transported to the great hotels of the western United States. The decor is fabulous, the rooms are quite large and the amenities are second to none. Plus, its proximity to the Magic Kingdom makes it ideal for families with small kids. A short boat ride drops you off at the entrance of the Magic Kingdom. That same boat makes it convenient to return to the WL for a brief respite mid-day. The WL is the least expensive of the "deluxe" Disney resort hotels and although it is pricy, you get what you pay for and it si worth every penny.
reviews.title: My Favorite Disney Hotel

reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Wilderness Lodge -- about 16 years since our first visit -- and it was quite enjoyable. We received an unexpected (but greatly appreciated) upgrade to the Concierge Level upon checking in. The Concierge personnel were very helpful and welcoming, and the lounge offered a great continental breakfast that sped us on our way to the parks early each day. If you stay on the Concierge Level, I'm not sure investing in the dining plan is necessary. The design and details in the lobby continue to impress us many years after our first visit. The hotel pool was fun, although I still prefer the pool complex at the Yacht and Beach Clubs. Artist Point did not disappoint -- great food & nice wine by the glass recommendations from our waiter. Finally, the trip to the Magic Kingdom is a breeze by bus or boat. (Note: getting to the other parks is not quite as quick from the Lodge because the buses make stops at other resorts.) In all, we very much enjoyed our return to the Wilderness Lodge.
reviews.title: Great theme & convenient to the Magic Kingdom

reviews.text: We enjoyed our 4 days @ the lodge, everything was first rate, eating @ whispering canyons was a lot of fun, just be careful about asking for ketchup. I wouldn't sugget getting a woods view, not worth the expense in my opinion.
reviews.title: Wilderness Lodge well worth the visit !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I've always consider myself a Disney person and have never stayed at a Deluxe Disney Resort (always stayed at Moderates), so with that said.........
reviews.title: Very nice stay, but.....

reviews.text: My wife and I (traveling alone) were offered an upgrade from Port Orleans Riverside to the Wilderness Lodge for a very modest price (Oct 17th thru the 22nd of 2011). As everyone else has said in other reviews here, the lobby is gorgeous, the boat ride to the magic kingdom is nice and relaxing, the pool area and grounds are immaculate, and the staff really go out of their way to make your stay here at the WL as pleasant as possible. Our room (5142) had a beautiful wooded balcony view of the Vacation Villas and their quiet pool.
reviews.title: Great location and good food!

reviews.text: There were a few small minor things that I would like to mention about the WL. The prices at the Whispering Canyon restaurant were a bit pricey ($28 for waffles, suasage, and coffee for wifey and I...not including the tip) however the food was good to very good. The cafeteria style restaurant's (Roarin' Forks) food was poor at best. The seating area is very small and congested, especially from 8 AM til 10 AM. Our room was sufficient, but I was expecting more from the bathroom area being a deluxe Disney hotel (very basic and similar to what you would have at Port Orleans Riverside).
reviews.title: Meh for a honeymoon package

reviews.text: This was my first stay at Disney. This place was beautiful. Its well worth the money although be careful with your meal plan,read what exactly you get.
reviews.title: Very Impressive

reviews.text: The hotel and servcies are brilliant,the pool area is stunning.
reviews.title: Loved The Wilderness Lodge

likes.liked: — Overall experience, just perfect for our family

reviews.text: Boat trips to the parks make it a very nice way to start and finish your day
reviews.title: Fantastic Disney Experience

reviews.text: The Wilderness Lodge was perfect setting for our family trip taking our 5 grandsons (along with their parents) to DisneyWorld for the first time. Hard decision choosing with such a large group, booking 3 rooms. So very glad we went with the WL and now that we've seen all the resorts, would choose this hotel again in an instant. It is beautiful with immaculate grounds and pools, yet feels so family friendly and comfortable. Everyone loved it!
reviews.title: Good experience overall, but beware the boat horns!

likes.liked: — Pool area, proximity to Magic Kingdom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were there for six days and visited all the parks but spent more time (and trips) to Magic Kingdom which is an advantage at WL. The bus is direct to and from and takes only about 5 minutes, no other stops. The dropoff and pickup at MK is the first slot so not much walking involved when you finally leave the park and are dead tired. The kids also enjoyed the boat ride direct to MK and Chef Mickey's (at Contemporary). The WL is the closest to MK off the monorail resorts and after riding the monorail also, the bus transport was much faster. To the other resorts, there was one or two stops but the bus was never crowded, always a seat and at night we were often the only ones on the bus.
reviews.title: Really liked Wilderness Lodge

likes.disliked: — Some of the guestrooms may be too shabby for the price.

reviews.text: Well my family and I went to the Wilderness Lodge from June 1st to June 9th. This was our 3rd time staying there! It is such an amazing hotel! The past two times we stayed in the villas, which were just outstanding! But this year, we decided to try something new. Instead of the villas, we decided to stay on the conceirge level. On this level, you get food layed out all day. Staying on this level was a little more than we thought of spending, but it was worth it!
reviews.title: Walt Disney's Best Yet!

likes.liked: — The staff was so sweet and the transportation of the bus and boat was great,fast,and easy!

reviews.title: Disney's Wilderness Lodge
reviews.text: Every morning my husband and I with our 3 kids( girl, 13 and two boys 10) would go up to the 7th floor for some breakfeast. They had everything layed out so neat and very organized. For breakfeast there was: chocolate and bluebarry muffins, rasin brand, cherrios, and corn flakes, orange juice, whole and skim milk, grapes,oranges,apples,and more fruit! Then after the park we would come back to the hotel at 12:00 because it was soo hot. But for the conceirge level did not have a lunch out durning the day. They did this because most of the people would be at the parks and it would be a waste of food. But instead they put out little snacks like : prezles, gummy bears, fruit, coffee, hot coco, and fruit. We put the gummy bears and pretzles and nuts in cups so we could bring it up to our room. Then since we needed lunch, my husband, Jim, and my two boys would go down to the "Roaring Forks" to buy lunch.

The pool at the hotel was also wonderful! They had a waterslide and a beautiful waterfall. The lobby is also something great! You look up and it is just absolutly gorgous! Our room was wonderful! We had a great housekeeper, or as Disney likes to call her, an "mouse"keeeper. She would give us fresh wash towels everyday and she would turn them into animals. Like one day we got towels shaped as a duck and a bunny rabbit!
reviews.title: Wilderness Lodge was wonderful!

likes.liked: — location to theme parks, hotel style, various transportation methods
likes.disliked: — $10 per day fee for internet in a deluxe resort

reviews.text: For the dinner on the conceirge level, they would have a diffrent main dish everynight. One night was grilled chicken with garlic mashed potatoes!!! WOW. That was amazing! My kids loved it! ( and trust me, if my kids liked it it must have been good cause they are all pickey eaters) Also for dinner along with the main dish was veggies, drinks( yes, and including beer and wine from 5-10) and uncrustables for the little kids. Also, for some nights the main dish was scalopes( i was the only one in my family to eat it) and other great foods that I cannot remember. The main dish would change every night along with the soups. They also have soup to go along with your dinner,too. One night which I personally think that was the BEST SOUP THAT I EVER TRIED was the Veggie Hearty. Yumm! Overall, I give the Wilderness Lodge a 5 star review. MY kids loved it and we are sure we are going again next year! The staff was just so sweet!
reviews.title: Wilderness is Beautiful

reviews.text: Stayed late June at Wilderness Lodge for the second time, it is a really good hotel and a very beautiful lodge. There are lit fireplaces on almost every floor with sitting areas for reading or watching TV outside your room. Somehow we got assigned to the 7th floor instead of our reserved courtyard view, but it turned out to be a bonus since we could watch the Magic Kingdom fireworks from our balcony, plus there is private concierge service and snacks provided by the Old Faithful Club - an all day snacking kitchen! Morning offers a free help yourself breakfast (with a pretty good selection), lunch and evenings offers other snacks including fruits, homemade cookies & milk, finger sandwiches and a small selection of wines, liquors, and alcohol - there's also a good quality coffee/cappaccino/espresso machine. The hotel has a bubbling spring just inside which runs to the outside and down the outside walkways amidst the generously landscaped grouds (Silver Creek Falls) until it turns into a large waterfall and empties into the pool, which is very inviting and with a nice slide for the kids. Just past the hot tubs is their Fire Rock geyser, which erupts every hour. We didn't use the pool bar (Trout Pass), but we enjoyed the Bay Lake beach and you can enjoy the nightly lights/musical parade sail by every evening. Their resterants are all good, with Whispering Canyon Cafe offering home-cooked meals at a reasonable price and the waiters provide entertainment and games; the highest priced is Artist Point - good food with smaller portions, not sure it's really worth the money (although the service was pretty good). but it was nice to try; the median priced resterant is Roaring Fork. The hotel has an excellent gift shop with a groceries selection, too. This hotel is also one of the few that has constant ferry service directly to the Magic Kingdom and is for hotel guest use only (comes in very handy after a long day in the park when you want to bypass most of the crowds to return to the hotel). Arcade, bike/boat rentals, hiking trails, premium fitness center, etc. This hotel also offers onsite airline check in and baggage check. We enjoy this hotel so much we skip the parks some nights and just stay at the lodge. Would recommend to most everyone if you have $300+/night to spend on accomodations.
reviews.title: Great week at Wilderness Lodge

likes.liked: — Location and pool area, hotel was very quiet at night
likes.disliked: — Counter service selections for breakfast...needs more variety

reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Wilderness Lodge. In years previous, we had stayed at the Polynesian, which we also enjoyed; however, the Wilderness Lodge was cheaper and just as good. We had a standard room, but were pleasantly surprised to have a peaceful view of the woods, with the lake in the background. The rooms are rather standard size, but you're not in the room that much anyway, so the size was not that important. Everything was very clean. We liked the fact that we could take a boat to the Magic Kingdom as an option. From there, we could connect to the Monorail to go to Epcot. The buses also ran fairly often from the Wilderness. We never had to wait over 10 minutes. The pool area was very inviting and has a small slide and two hot tubs. The people who worked at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. When we checked in, we were also pleasantly surprised to find out that access to the concierge floor was included in our stay. This saved us quite a bit of money since we ate our breakfast there every morning and there was enough food in the evening to make a light meal, which we did one night when we came back from the parks early for a break.
reviews.title: Pleasant Stay

reviews.text: We used the Disney Magical Express and checked our bags all the way to the hotel. I was a little hesitant to do this at first, but am glad we did. When we arrived back in our rooms later the first night, our bags were all there. We also checked our bags all the way home at the hotel the day we left and they all arrived safely. It sure made walking around the airports much easier!
reviews.title: Great Hotel, nice location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We recently stayed at the Wilderness Lodge. We have 2 kids (4 and 6). I was going to book the Contemporary, but the only rooms available were the very expensive ones, so I switched to the Wilderness Lodge.
reviews.title: Wild About the Wilderness

likes.disliked: — being centrally located, yet some inconveniences with getting places

reviews.text: It is a good hotel, convenient to the Magic Kingdom. It is not on the monorail, but it has direct boat service to the Magic Kingdom and another boat service to the Fort Wilderness and the Contemporary. The Grand Floridian is a short bus ride away. This is convenient for when you have restaurant reservations in these other hotels. The restaurant Whispering Canyon was ok, I preferred the Grand Floridian Cafe and Chef Mickeys.
reviews.title: Great family experience, non Deluxe Hotel

likes.liked: — Family oriented, wondeful decorations and landscape
likes.disliked: — Too cold inside, rooms are not what price deserve

reviews.title: Great location -- good time!
reviews.text: The rooms were fine, plenty of space. We had a woods view and was very quiet. It overlooked some trees and you could also see the lagoon.
First of all, I want to say that we have stayed in every resort at Walt Disney World, except the vacation clubs, and the Wilderness Lodge is still our favorite.
reviews.title: Our favorite Disney property

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our third time staying at the Wilderness Lodge, and once again, we were very pleased. The hotel is simply beautiful, and the lobby is amazing. One of my favorite pasttimes at the lodge is sitting on one of the rockers while admiring the lobby. The view from our balcony was wonderful too.
reviews.title: Wilderness Lodge...a wonderful experience

reviews.text: To travel to the Magic Kingdom, we used the boat shuttle, and it worked out great for us. We never waited longer than 5-10 minutes. To travel to the other parks, we used the bus service, and this was sometimes a problem. The buses made multiple stops and took forever. We waited 30 minutes a couple of times.
reviews.title: Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Unlike other posters, we received great service from everyone on staff.
reviews.title: Worth seeing once but dont expect good service

reviews.text: We spent the last few days at the Wilderness Lodge. It is a beautiful resort. The service was excellent. Transportation to and from the parks was great. This resort offers a very relaxing atmosphere in a beautiful setting. We hope to visit again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel but beware

likes.disliked: — checkout time, pool size, room size

description: Disney's Wilderness Lodge—inspired by the Great American Northwest National Park lodges from the turn of the 20th century—is an architecturally grand Disney Deluxe Resort hotel honoring American craftsmanship and artistry, and celebrating the majesty of the unspoiled wilderness.
